channel.title: Dual Loging in Help, Jagex changed the files
channel.description:
The original files you used to have to delete or set to read only to dual login were: C:\WINDOWS\.file_store_32\uid.dat C:\WINDOWS\.jagex_cache_32\uid.dat C:\WINDOWS\.jagex_cache_34\uid.dat
Now it seems those files don't exist at all, and yet you still can't dual login. I can't seem to figure out which file it is, does anyone have any ideas?

item.title: Dual Loging in Help, Jagex changed the files
item.dc:creator: @b_bob0 b bob0
item.description:
@b_bob0 wrote:

how i need that to how do i do that can u teach me the logging out 1 too?if u know

Read full topic

item.title: Dual Loging in Help, Jagex changed the files
item.dc:creator: @nicatron nicatron
item.description:
@nicatron wrote:

b bob0:

can u guys tell me wats dual loging is it the 1 when ur fighting and u log out and u save ur money?if ur staking can u tell me how to do that please

dual logging in is where two or more accounts are logged on at the same time for one goal
ex: drop trading

Read full topic

item.title: Dual Loging in Help, Jagex changed the files
item.dc:creator: @frank frank_
item.description:
@frank wrote:

you contacted me, not the other way round
i dont have the pm’s in my inbox, but i have the ones that i replied

i am sorry, it isnt boolean, but it is a value

        if(triangleTransparency == null)
            DrawingArea3D.transparency = 0;
        else
            DrawingArea3D.transparency = triangleTransparency[i] & 0xff;

you might have directectly edited the array as it was loaded though, as they say, there is more than one way to skin a cat

Read full topic

dont be put off by the fact that you cant claim ownership for something i have done, i will check my irc logs if you are that upset

Oh contrary, there is no boolean. You’re bullshit from start to finish.

From start, when you asked me to help you make a java bytecode bot for rs… And instead you made a keylogger and stole peoples gear/items/gp, to finish, this. Oh and the neat part about it, you made it auto updating…

EDIT: End of conversation.

item.title: Dual Loging in Help, Jagex changed the files
item.dc:creator: @pplsuqbawlz pplsuqbawlz
item.description:
@pplsuqbawlz wrote:

[code]They are not checking IPs.

These are proven (by myself) facts:

-The login packet contains 24 bytes which are sent to the server.

-Changing one of these 24 bytes makes dual login possible.

-Random.dat is 24 bytes long.[/code]

Don’t be silly ZSTARS. They do check IP. This is, will be, and will constantly be, a fact. If they do not track IP’s they cannot tell what to bill the ad agencies that run on the free servers… Hence no fat paycheck, hence no free servers… So don’t lie and say they don’t, because they do; They not only track them, they monitor them closely.

I mean don’t get me wrong, I’m all for someone else finally picking up the client and actually learning from it, but don’t get in over your head mate… There’s a rule in life, someone, somewhere, is always better. The thing to do is find them, and emulate them, but better. Hence semaphore is my better, winterlove is semaphore’s better (wL has alot of “secret projects” that I’m not supposed to know about, but dude, he leaves an internet trail the size of mount everest)… However I suppose jagex is winterlove’s better… There is no way you can be the best. If you become the best, don’t take it to heart, there will be someone better in the blink of an eye.

Never be afraid to ask for help… If denied, don’t take it personally. Try again and again.

EDIT: It’s not as random as the name would have you think, goodgame jagex for being terribly misleading though.
EDIT2: Anyway, I’ve moved on since then, I’m now mapping some more interesting things…

First one to spot what I’ve done here… Gets a cookie… Here’s a hint on this discovery: Look at the windows!

EDIT3: And/or look at the image’s name…

Read full topic

item.title: Dual Loging in Help, Jagex changed the files
item.dc:creator: @Mr_Covey Mr Covey
item.description:
@Mr_Covey wrote:

Yer i had a second look and figured out that the random.dat is infact the old uid.dat file but only its now a random access file.

I also found out that if you (while you don’t have runescape open) sets its property to read only it will create another file in a different folder (8 files in total)
c:\windows.file_store_32
c:\window.jagex_store_32
c:.file_store_32
c:.jagex_store_32
c:\java.file_store_32
c:\java.jagex_store_32
c:\program files\eliteswitch.file_store_32 (if you are using a different client it wil lstore it there etc)
c:\program files\eliteswitch.jagex_store_32

and once you have set all those to read only, and you go to load a world it will display an error message and not load the world.

and see as its way too much code to grab RAF handles in vb6 ill guess im sticking to the old unsigned

Read full topic
item.source: Dual Loging in Help, Jagex changed the files

item.title: Dual Loging in Help, Jagex changed the files
item.dc:creator: @Ollie Ollie
item.description:
@Ollie wrote:

Moparisthebest:

You will have to simply use the unsigned client (which can not write to or read from your harddrive), it seems random.dat has pretty much replaced UID.dat, but if you noticed they open it as a RandomAccessFile and keep a handle to it in the signlink class, that means it is ‘in use’ while the game is running and can not be modified or deleted.

what i do now is

getSignLink().getUID().getRandomAccessFile().writeInt(UserID);

Read full topic

Thanks for all your help guys.
